book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: A copy of an epistle, which Jeremy sent unto them which were to be led captives into Babylon by the king of the Babylonians, to certify them, as it was commanded him of God.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Because of the sins which ye have committed before God, ye shall be led away captives into Babylon by Nabuchodonosor king of the Babylonians.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: So when ye be come unto Babylon, ye shall remain there many years, and for a long season, namely, seven generations: and after that I will bring you away peaceably from thence.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Now shall ye see in Babylon gods of silver, and of gold, and of wood, borne upon shoulders, which cause the nations to fear.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Beware therefore that ye in no wise be like to strangers, neither be ye afraid of them, when ye see the multitude before them and behind them, worshipping them.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: But say ye in your hearts, O Lord, we must worship thee.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: For mine angel is with you, and I myself caring for your souls.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: As for their tongue, it is polished by the workman, and they themselves are gilded and laid over with gold; yet are they but false, and cannot speak.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: And taking gold, as it were for a virgin that loveth to go gay, they make crowns for the heads of their gods.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Sometimes also the priests convey from their gods gold and silver, and bestow it upon themselves.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Yea, they will give thereof to the common harlots, and deck them as men with garments, [being] gods of silver, and gods of gold, and wood.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Yet cannot these gods save themselves from rust and moths, though they be covered with purple raiment.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: They wipe their faces because of the dust of the temple, when there is much upon them.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: And he that cannot put to death one that offendeth him holdeth a sceptre, as though he were a judge of the country.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: He hath also in his right hand a dagger and an axe: but cannot deliver himself from war and thieves.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Whereby they are known not to be gods: therefore fear them not.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: For like as a vessel that a man useth is nothing worth when it is broken; even so it is with their gods: when they be set up in the temple, their eyes be full of dust through the feet of them that come in.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: And as the doors are made sure on every side upon him that offendeth the king, as being committed to suffer death; even so the priests make fast their temples with doors, with locks, and bars, lest their gods be spoiled with robbers.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: They light them candles, yea, more than for themselves, whereof they cannot see one.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: They are as one of the beams of the temple, yet they say their hearts are gnawed upon by things creeping out of the earth; and when they eat them and their clothes, they feel it not.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Their faces are blacked through the smoke that cometh out of the temple.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Upon their bodies and heads sit bats, swallows, and birds, and the cats also.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: By this ye may know that they are no gods: therefore fear them not.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Notwithstanding the gold that is about them to make them beautiful, except they wipe off the rust, they will not shine: for neither when they were molten did they feel it.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: The things wherein there is no breath are bought for a most high price.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: They are borne upon shoulders, having no feet, whereby they declare unto men that they be nothing worth.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: They also that serve them are ashamed: for if they fall to the ground at any time, they cannot rise up again of themselves: neither, if one set them upright, can they move of themselves: neither, if they be bowed down, can they make themselves straight: but they set gifts before them, as unto dead men.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: As for the things that are sacrificed unto them, their priests sell and abuse; in like manner their wives lay up part thereof in salt; but unto the poor and impotent they give nothing of it.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Menstruous women and women in childbed eat their sacrifices: by these things ye may know that they are no gods: fear them not.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: For how can they be called gods? because women set meat before the gods of silver, gold, and wood.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: And the priests sit in their temples, having their clothes rent, and their heads and beards shaven, and nothing upon their heads.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: They roar and cry before their gods, as men do at the feast when one is dead.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: The priests also take off their garments, and clothe their wives and children.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Whether it be evil that one doeth unto them, or good, they are not able to recompense it: they can neither set up a king, nor put him down.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: In like manner, they can neither give riches nor money: though a man make a vow unto them, and keep it not, they will not require it.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: They can save no man from death, neither deliver the weak from the mighty.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: They cannot restore a blind man to his sight, nor help any man in his distress.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: They can shew no mercy to the widow, nor do good to the fatherless.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Their gods of wood, and which are overlaid with gold and silver, are like the stones that be hewn out of the mountain: they that worship them shall be confounded.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: How should a man then think and say that they are gods, when even the Chaldeans themselves dishonour them?

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Who if they shall see one dumb that cannot speak, they bring him, and intreat Bel that he may speak, as though he were able to understand.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Yet they cannot understand this themselves, and leave them: for they have no knowledge.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: The women also with cords about them, sitting in the ways, burn bran for perfume: but if any of them, drawn by some that passeth by, lie with him, she reproacheth her fellow, that she was not thought as worthy as herself, nor her cord broken.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Whatsoever is done among them is false: how may it then be thought or said that they are gods?

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: They are made of carpenters and goldsmiths: they can be nothing else than the workmen will have them to be.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: And they themselves that made them can never continue long; how should then the things that are made of them be gods?

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: For they left lies and reproaches to them that come after.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: For when there cometh any war or plague upon them, the priests consult with themselves, where they may be hidden with them.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: How then cannot men perceive that they be no gods, which can neither save themselves from war, nor from plague?

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: For seeing they be but of wood, and overlaid with silver and gold, it shall be known hereafter that they are false:

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: and it shall manifestly appear to all nations and kings that they are no gods, but the works of men's hands, and that there is no work of God in them.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Who then may not know that they are no gods?

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: For neither can they set up a king in the land, nor give rain unto men.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Neither can they judge their own cause, nor redress a wrong, being unable: for they are as crows between heaven and earth.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Whereupon when fire falleth upon the house of gods of wood, or laid over with gold or silver, their priests will flee away, and escape: but they themselves shall be burned asunder like beams.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Moreover they cannot withstand any king or enemies: how can it then be thought or said that they be gods?

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Neither are those gods of wood, and laid over with silver or gold, able to escape either from thieves or robbers.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Whose gold, and silver, and garments wherewith they are clothed, they that are strong do take, and go away withal: neither are they able to help themselves.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Therefore it is better to be a king that sheweth his power, or else a profitable vessel in an house, which the owner shall have use of, than such false gods; or to be a door in an house, to keep such things safe as be therein, than such false gods; or a pillar of wood in a palace, than such false gods.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: For sun, moon, and stars, being bright, and sent to do their offices, are obedient.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: In like manner the lightning when it breaketh forth is easy to be seen: and after the same manner the wind bloweth in every country.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: And when God commandeth the clouds to go over the whole world, they do as they are bidden.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: And the fire sent from above to consume hills and woods doeth as it is commanded: but these are like unto them neither in shew nor power.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Wherefore it is neither to be supposed nor said that they are gods, seeing they are able neither to judge causes, nor to do good unto men.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Knowing therefore that they are no gods, fear them not.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: For they can neither curse nor bless kings:

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: neither can they shew signs in the heavens among the heathen, nor shine as the sun, nor give light as the moon.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: The beasts are better than they: for they can get under a covert, and help themselves.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: It is then by no means manifest unto us that they are gods: therefore fear them not.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: For as a scarecrow in a garden of cucumbers keepeth nothing: so are their gods of wood, and laid over with silver and gold.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: And likewise their gods of wood, and laid over with silver and gold, are like to a white thorn in an orchard, that every bird sitteth upon; as also to a dead body, that is cast into the dark.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: And ye shall know them to be no gods by the bright purple that rotteth upon them: and they themselves afterward shall be eaten, and shall be a reproach in the country.

book_title: Brenton Septuagint Translation Epistle of Jeremy 1
verse_text: Better therefore is the just man that hath no idols: for he shall be far from reproach.
